data.name: String to Object #1 - preformatted (easy)
data.description:
A rental manager enters costs for househeeting into sheet cell for every apartment individually. 

For make further processing easy, costs are entered in a preformatted way.
When data will be read to a javascript program, it will be a string.

So manager enters data like:

```{"apartNumber": cost, "apartNumber": cost, ...}```

or, as example:

```{"1": 100, "2": 100, "3": 150}```

As it will be convert to a string, while reading, input for the function will be a string:

```'{"1": 100, "2": 100, "3": 150}'```

Manager is not so much accurate, so it can put some spaces accidentally in any place. Hopefully, not inside numbers.

A programmer doesn't remember, what will be the data for an empty cell after reading. Probably, it will be undefined or an empty string. And an empty cell can be a case. Some monthes heating is off. 

Write a function, which will convert this string pseudo-object input to a real object.
